Starting Position: Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart and arms by your sides.
Ground Yourself: Root down through your feet, feeling stable and balanced.
Inhale: As you inhale, raise your arms out to the sides, parallel to the floor, with palms facing down.

Exhale: On the exhale, twist your torso to the right, bringing your left hand to your right shoulder and your right hand behind your back.
Gaze: Look over your right shoulder, keeping your chin parallel to the floor.
Maintain Alignment: Keep your hips facing forward and both feet firmly planted on the ground.

Breathe: Take deep breaths as you hold the twist, feeling the stretch along your spine and across your chest.
Inhale to Center: Inhale as you return to the center, arms outstretched.

Exhale and Repeat: Exhale as you twist to the left, bringing your right hand to your left shoulder and your left hand behind your back. Gaze over your left shoulder.
Repeat: Continue alternating sides for several rounds, moving with your breath and maintaining fluidity in the movement.

Mindfulness: Stay present and mindful throughout the practice, focusing on the sensations in your body and the rhythm of your breath.
Modifications: If you have any back or spinal issues, practice the twist gently and avoid over-twisting. You can also perform the movement with your hands on your hips for support.
Duration: Hold each twist for a few breaths, gradually increasing the duration as you become more comfortable with the pose.
Relaxation: After completing the practice, take a moment to stand tall and breathe deeply, allowing your body to integrate the benefits of the pose.\n\n
